videoSnippet.title: Missing Mate in 2! | Meier vs Carlsen | Grenke Chess Classic 2018.
videoSnippet.description:
#agadmator Check out the interview with Meier here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jQkN6vLeH4Y

Check out Round 5 Impressions video here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8_cQgXLpIU8

Georg Meier vs Magnus Carlsen
GRENKE Chess Classic (2018), rd 5, Apr-05 
Indian Game: Anti-Nimzo-Indian (E10)

1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 d5 4. g3 Bb4 5. Bd2 Be7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Nbd7 8. Qc2 c6 9. Bf4 Ne4 10. h4 Ndf6 11. Nbd2 Nd2 12. Nd2 Nh5 13. Be3 f5 14. Bf3 Qe8 15. Bg5 Nf6 16. e3 b6 17. Rac1 Ba6 18. a3 Ne4 19. Be7 Qe7 20. Be2 Bb7 21. b4 Rac8 22. c5 e5 23. de5 Qe5 24. Ne4 fe4 25. Qc3 Qf5 26. a4 g5 27. hg5 Qg5 28. Kg2 Rc7 29. Rh1 Rg7 30. Rcg1 Qf5 31. Rf1 Ba6 32. b5 cb5 33. Rh5 Qf7 34. Qe5 Bb7 35. cb6 ba4 36. ba7 Ba8 37. Rg5 Qa7 38. Bg4 Kh8 39. Ra1 Qe7 40. Qg7 Qg7 41. Rg7 Kg7 42. Ra4 Bc6 43. Rb4

The 2018 GRENKE Chess Classic is a 10-player round-robin held in Germany from 31 March to 9 April. The first 3 rounds are in Karlsruhe alongside the GRENKE Chess Open, then after a rest day the last 6 rounds are in the Kulturhaus LA8 in Baden-Baden. The field features World Champion Magnus Carlsen and fellow Top 10 players Fabiano Caruana, Maxime Vachier-Lagrave, Vishy Anand and Levon Aronian, as well as women's no. 1 Hou Yifan.

The time control is 100 minutes for 40 moves, then 50 minutes for 20 moves and then 15 minutes to the end of the game, with a 30-second increment from move 1. If players are tied for first place a rapid play-off will take place. Official website: www.grenkechessclassic.com
